# Mirrorstoolkit in R

## What

Welcome to Mirrorstoolkit (in R)! It is a collection for data analyses
deployed in my research works.

My workflow is generally working with Python on a HPC cluster and have
the result visualized in R. Thus this part will be more about quick
exploratory visualization and statistic analysis.

I abstracted and wrapped them from my previous projects for those
implementations which are either:

- Frequently deployed.
- A bit wordy in the implementation.
- Might be deployed again in future project.
- Very R: I’m a pythonic person, my practice is very seaborn-like.

## Why

This is majorly for my personal usage (thus it won’t be on CRAN). But
I’ll keep it maintained here. Feel free to grab anything you like.

## Who

If you are: - Biomed person who need a basic stat wrappers (and your
supervisor won’t check your code XD). - As what I mentioned, python
Pandas person. I hope it can make your life easier.

## Where

The environment is in DESCRIPTION.

I’m using a Macbook 2016 with macOS Monterey 12.7.6. Running R 4.4.0
with tidyverse family. I’ll make sure all the packages I used is based
on CRAN.

Dependency note: This package has a part heavily depend on dplyr::do()
which is officially superseded. But I haven’t find a proper way to deal
with it by dplyr::reframe(), dplyr::nest_by(), and dplyr::pick() as what
dplyr claimed. I’ll try to finish it before its official deprecation.

## When

I’ll keep growing this one. Along with its Python counterpart
(<https://github.com/alexliyihao/mirrorstoolkit>)

## How

    devtools::install_github("alexliyihao/mirrorstoolkit_r")
    library(mirrorstoolkit)

# Acknowledgements

All the code are abstracted from my daily task in: - Gissette Soffer Lab
(Division of Preventive Medicine, Dept. of Medicine, CUIMC)  
- Badri Vardarajan Lab (Gertrude H. Sergievsky Center, Dept. of
Neurology, CUIMC)

# Package index

## All functions

- [`OLS_wrapper()`](OLS_wrapper.md) : Ordinary Linear Regression wrapper
  with multi variable of interest and stratification
- [`OLS_wrapper_()`](OLS_wrapper_.md) : Ordinary Linear Regression with
  multi variable of interest
- [`characteristic_table_generator()`](characteristic_table_generator.md)
  : Characteristic Table Generator
- [`characteristic_wrapper()`](characteristic_wrapper.md) : Single
  column inspector
- [`clean_correlation_matrix()`](clean_correlation_matrix.md) : Function
  cleaning input and computing correlation matrix
- [`compute_nih_ldl()`](compute_nih_ldl.md) : NIH 2 equation, also known
  as the Sampson-NIH equation
- [`correlation_matrix_dataframe()`](correlation_matrix_dataframe.md) :
  Function wrapper compute pairwise correlation matrix and return as a
  data.frame
- [`correlation_matrix_plot()`](correlation_matrix_plot.md) : Function
  wrapper compute pairwise correlation matrix and return as a
  visualization format
- [`create_multi_color_palette()`](create_multi_color_palette.md) :
  Create a non-white color palette for ggplot2 based on
  Polychrome::glasbey.colors
- [`distinguishable_palette()`](distinguishable_palette.md) : Wrapper
  creating a distinguishable, non-white color palette for ggplot2 based
  on Polychrome::glasbey.colors
- [`enrichment_rank()`](enrichment_rank.md) : Distribution illustration
  for proteomics/lipidomics, etc
- [`flatten_correlation_matrix()`](flatten_correlation_matrix.md) :
  Function cleaning correlation matrix to pairwise dataframe
- [`generate_boolean_ratio_output()`](generate_boolean_ratio_output.md)
  : Characteristics for boolean variable
- [`generate_continuous_IQR_output()`](generate_continuous_IQR_output.md)
  : Characteristics for non-normality distributed variable
- [`generate_continuous_sd_output()`](generate_continuous_sd_output.md)
  : Characteristics for normality distributed variable
- [`inspect_distribution()`](inspect_distribution.md) : Wrapper quickly
  check the distribution from Shapiro-Wilk test and visualization
- [`linear_regression()`](linear_regression.md) : Ordinary Linear
  Regression
- [`logistic_regression()`](logistic_regression.md) : Logistics Linear
  Regression
- [`logistic_wrapper()`](logistic_wrapper.md) : Logistics Linear
  Regression wrapper with multi variable of interest and stratification
- [`logistic_wrapper_()`](logistic_wrapper_.md) : Logistics Linear
  Regression with multi-variable of interest
- [`manhattan_data_clean()`](manhattan_data_clean.md) : Clean format for
  a Manhattan plot
- [`manhattan_plot()`](manhattan_plot.md) : Wrapper for a Manhattan plot
- [`multi_line_summary()`](multi_line_summary.md) : Multi-column Summary
- [`multi_omics_directed_acyclic_graph()`](multi_omics_directed_acyclic_graph.md)
  : Generate and preview a directed acyclic graph for multi-omics result
- [`normality_table()`](normality_table.md) : Shapiro-Wilk test on each
  variable
- [`pairwise_boolean_report()`](pairwise_boolean_report.md) : A wrapper
  preparing pairwise distribution comparison report for boolean(0/1)
  variables
- [`pairwise_boolean_table()`](pairwise_boolean_table.md) : Pairwise
  distribution comparison report for boolean(0/1) variables
- [`pairwise_boolean_test()`](pairwise_boolean_test.md) : Pairwise
  distribution comparison report for boolean(0/1) variable
- [`pairwise_t_test_report()`](pairwise_t_test_report.md) : A wrapper
  preparing pairwise distribution comparison report normally distributed
  variables
- [`pairwise_t_test_table()`](pairwise_t_test_table.md) : Pairwise
  distribution comparison report for normally distributed variables
- [`pairwise_wilcox_report()`](pairwise_wilcox_report.md) : A wrapper
  preparing pairwise distribution comparison report normally distributed
  variables
- [`pairwise_wilcox_table()`](pairwise_wilcox_table.md) : Pairwise
  distribution comparison report for non-normally distributed variables
- [`rms_illustration_3d()`](rms_illustration_3d.md) : 3d visualization
  for rms fit object
- [`trend_bar_chart()`](trend_bar_chart.md) : A fill bar chart for
  composition over a specific variable
